head.title: Quantum oscillations in metallic SbTeSe topological insulator
head.abstract: We have studied the magnetotransport properties of the metallic, -type SbTeSe which is a topological insulator. Magnetoresistance shows Shubnikov de Haas oscillations in fields above =15 T. The maxima/minima positions of oscillations measured at different tilt angles with respect to the direction align with the normal component of field cos, implying the existence of a 2D Fermi surface in SbTeSe. The value of the Berry phase determined from a Landau level fan diagram is very close to 0.5, further suggesting that the oscillations result from topological surface states. From Lifshitz-Kosevich analyses, the position of the Fermi level is found to be =250 meV, above the Dirac point. This value of is almost 3 times as large as that in our previous study on the BiSeTe topological insulator; however, it still touches the tip of the bulk valence band. This explains the metallic behavior and hole-like bulk charge carriers in the SbTeSe compound.

outline._note: This work is supported in part by the U.S. Air Force Office of Scientific Research, the T. L. L. Temple Foundation, the J. J. and R. Moores Endowment, and the State of Texas through the TCSUH. V. Marinova acknowledges support from the Bulgarian Science Fund, project FNI-T-02/26. A portion of this work was performed at the National High Magnetic Field Laboratory, which is supported by National Science Foundation Cooperative Agreement No. DMR-1157490 and the State of Florida. The work at Idaho National Laboratory is supported by Department of Energy, Office of Basic Energy Sciences, Materials Sciences, and Engineering Division and through grant DOE FG02-01ER45872.
